title: ISic000146. Funerary inscription for Publius Cestius Catullus
body:
Facsimile Images

P(ublio) ((·)) Cestio ((·)) Catullo
ann(orum) ((·)) ((Ↄ)) ( vac. 4) XXVII
et ((·)) P(ublio) ((·)) Cestio ( vac. 1) Catullo
patri

Apparatus criticus

Text from autopsy

English translation

To Publius Cestius Catullus, approximately(?) 27 years of age, and his father Publius Cestius Catullus.

commentary

There is no immediately clear answer as to what the sign "Ↄ", a reverse C, symbolises here; cf. ISic000163 and ISic000174 as well as CIL 6.15139 (Rome) for analogous use, as pointed out by Bivona (1994), who suggests that it stands for 'circiter'. The gens Cestius is well attested in Termini, often with the cognomen Catullus.

bibliography

  • Fazello 1558 Prioris Decadis, Liber Nonus, p.194 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002606
  • Gualtherus 1624 no. 86 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002388
  • Gualtherus 1624 [1625] no.245 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001931
  • Castelli 1769 cl.5 no.11 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002084
  • Castelli 1784 cl.5 no.11 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002083
  • 10.7385 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000589
  • 65 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
Licensed under a Creative Commons-Attribution 4.0 licence.
